meanings.definition: Trindles (noun): small wheels or rollers used to support heavy objects
meanings.sent1: The trindles on the cart helped it move smoothly across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The furniture had tiny trindles underneath for easy moving.
meanings.sent3: The trindles on the toy car made it zoom around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes followed the trindles of the conveyor belt as they carried the boxes away.
meanings.sent5: The trindles on the suitcase made it effortless to pull along.

meanings.definition: Trindles (verb): to move slowly and steadily, as if on wheels
meanings.sent1: The turtle trindles along the path, taking its time to reach the pond.
meanings.sent2: She trindles through the crowd, careful not to bump into anyone.
meanings.sent3: The snail trindles its way up the leaf, enjoying the view from above.
meanings.sent4: Time trindles forward, never stopping for anyone or anything.
meanings.sent5: The old car trindles down the road, its engine purring softly.
